linkTarget.anchoringText: In statistical research, there are several types of relationships (Figure 1).

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Types of correlation relationships of variables

formatted-caption.caption-text: Types of correlation relationships of variables

linkTarget.anchoringText: Construction of area maps (well drainage areas) (Figure 2).

image-wrap.label: Figure 2
image-wrap.caption: Fragment of the area map of the Lovinskoye deposit

formatted-caption.caption-text: Fragment of the area map of the Lovinskoye deposit

linkTarget.anchoringText: Based on the results of the calculation of all four probabilities Pi (Nop), Pi (comp), Pi (scont) and Pi (rr), probability maps were constructed separately both for each factor and for the total probability equal to the sum of probabilities of each factor (Figure 3).

image-wrap.label: Figure 3
image-wrap.caption: Map of total probability (P total) of the Lovinskoye deposit

formatted-caption.caption-text: Map of total probability (P total) of the Lovinskoye deposit

linkTarget.anchoringText: Based on the data obtained, an area map of probabilities of residual oil reserve areas for the Lovinskoye deposit was constructed (Figure 4).

image-wrap.label: Figure 4
image-wrap.caption: Area map of total probability of the Lovinskoye deposit

formatted-caption.caption-text: Area map of total probability of the Lovinskoye deposit

linkTarget.anchoringText: To obtain areas of residual oil reserves, the resulting map of total probability was multiplied by maps of initial mobile and geological oil reserves (Figures 5-6).

image-wrap.label: Figure 5
image-wrap.caption: Map of the product of total probability P total and initial mobile oil reserves from GHM

formatted-caption.caption-text: Map of the product of total probability P total and initial mobile oil reserves from GHM

linkTarget.anchoringText: To obtain areas of residual oil reserves, the resulting map of total probability was multiplied by maps of initial mobile and geological oil reserves (Figures 5-6).

image-wrap.label: Figure 6
image-wrap.caption: Map of the product of a map of total probability P total and a map of initial geological reserves from GHM

formatted-caption.caption-text: Map of the product of a map of total probability P total and a map of initial geological reserves from GHM

linkTarget.anchoringText: For comparison, a map of current mobile reserves obtained by adapting a geological and hydrodynamic model to the development history as of 01.01.2017 (Figure 7) is presented, followed by a comparison of the obtained maps with a map of current mobile reserves (Figure 8).

image-wrap.label: Figure 7
image-wrap.caption: Map of current mobile reserves from GHM as of 01.01.2017

formatted-caption.caption-text: Map of current mobile reserves from GHM as of 01.01.2017

linkTarget.anchoringText: For comparison, a map of current mobile reserves obtained by adapting a geological and hydrodynamic model to the development history as of 01.01.2017 (Figure 7) is presented, followed by a comparison of the obtained maps with a map of current mobile reserves (Figure 8).

image-wrap.label: Figure 8
image-wrap.caption: Comparison of values of a map of the product of initial geological and mobile reserves by P total with a map of current mobile reserves

formatted-caption.caption-text: Comparison of values of a map of the product of initial geological and mobile reserves by P total with a map of current mobile reserves

figure-specific-caption.caption-text: Comparison of values of the map of the product of initial mobile reserves to p total and maps of mobile reserves
Comparison of values of the map of the product of initial geological reserves to P total and maps of mobile reserves
